column1: STAY CONNECTEDEMAIL LORETTASUBSCRIBEDear Friend –Every year millions of Americans are affected by fraud and identity theft.
I want to make sure you aren't one of them.

That's why I'm holding aFraud and Identity Theft Awareness WorkshopTOMORROW Saturday, February 21 from 10:00 am to 12:00 pmat the Rancho Santiago Community College District Boardroom located at 2323 N. Broadway in Santa Ana.

At my workshop you'll learn about tax fraud, mail scams, social security benefits scams and immigration fraud from representatives of the Internal Revenue Service, Social Security Administration, United States Postal Service and the United States Citizenship and Immigration Service.
The event will also feature resource tables to provide you with tools to combat fraud.

Specifically, my office will be distributing a 43-page booklet from the Federal Trade Commission titled “ Taking Charge: What To Do If Your Identity Is Stolen .”This publication outlines steps to reduce the risk andrepair the damageof identity theft.

If you would like to attend or have questions, please contact my district office at (714) 621-0102 orca46RSVP@mail.house.govVery truly yours,Loretta SanchezMember of CongressOFFICE LOCATIONSWASHINGTON DC OFFICE1211 Longworth HOBWashington DC 20515Phone: (202) 225-2965Fax: (202) 225-1859DISTRICT OFFICE12397 Lewis Street, Suite 101Garden Grove, CA 92840Phone: (714) 621-0102Fax: (714) 621-0401Privacy Policy|Unsubscribe
